12.20.text:
SPEAKER 1: So I'd like to talk
about the topic of curation,

14.91.text:
which has become a huge topic
these days as we try to manage

21.32.text:
We're all suffering from intense
information and bandwidth

25.21.text:
We're like a 56K modem trying
to download 10,000 hours of HD

30.97.text:
We simply lack the
biological hardware

33.84.text:
to actually take in all of the
information that's competing

38.60.text:
So curation has
become the buzzword.

41.40.text:
The information diet of every
single person is now the craze.

45.57.text:
How are you going to curate
your information diet?

48.29.text:
Are you going to just
create a filter bubble?

52.85.text:
Curation cannot just be
filtering out when you

56.31.text:
Curation needs to
be about creating

57.97.text:
the conditions in which
you can discover what

61.74.text:
When you can discover what you
didn't know would be useful.

64.20.text:
Curation should be
all about serendipity,

66.70.text:
which is look for something,
find something else,

68.94.text:
and realize that
what you found was

70.40.text:
more conducive to your
needs than what you

73.44.text:
So the question today becomes,
can we design algorithms,

76.59.text:
can we design apps
that can leverage

80.71.text:
contextual computing, big
data, finding patterns,

84.47.text:
create random patterns,
so on and so forth,

95.89.text:
that we're able to absorb
from those information fields.

98.31.text:
So that's how I feel about
the pivotal role of curation

102.67.text: And we need to figure it out.
